greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A dragon curve is drawn on an Ulam spiral; a(n) is the integer written in the cell reached at step n.
comment: The spiral consists of the numbers 0, 1, 2, ... written in a spiral on squared paper. The dragon curve is a self-similar curve starting at the same point. See the illustration for more information.
link: Philippe Lallouet, Spreadsheet with illustration of initial terms
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Dragon Curve [From _Klaus Brockhaus_, Aug 07 2008]
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime Spiral [From _Klaus Brockhaus_, Aug 07 2008]
xref: Cf. A014577 (regular paper-folding [or dragon curve] sequence). [From _Klaus Brockhaus_, Aug 07 2008]
results.author: Philippe Lallouet (philip.lallouet(AT)wanadoo.fr), Mar 18 2007
